newsitem.title: GREECE: OBJECTIVE CRITERION ABOLISHED WITHIN FOUR YEARS - SIMITIS.
newsitem.headline: OBJECTIVE CRITERION ABOLISHED WITHIN FOUR YEARS - SIMITIS.

text.p: Prime Minister Costas Simitis said that the objective criterion, a tax measure affecting small and medium businesses, will be abolished within four years, once the computerisation of the finance minstry is completed.

"The objective criterion will be abolished when the finance ministry has the means to cross check the income of those inolved. I expect it to happen soon and certainly within the next four years," Simitis told a news conference.
Finance Minister Alexandros Papadopoulos imposed the measure last year which calls on shop owners and self-employed Greeks to pay a minimum tax regardless of their income.
Conservative opposition leader Miltiadis Evert has called for the abolition of the objective criteria within 30 days if he wins the September 22 snap poll.

Simitis also called for the creation of some 180,000 new jobs in the next three years and for more social security benefits for farmers and low income pensioners. --Costas Paris, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
